results.title: Germano Celant, Curator Behind Italy’s Arte Povera, Dies at 79
results.abstract: He identified the “poor art” avant-garde movement and was an internationally renowned curator at the Guggenheim Museum in New York and the Fondazione Prada in Milan.

multimedia.caption: Mr. Celant at “Post Zang Tumb Tuuum,” a sprawling year-by-year study of the art of Fascist Italy that he organized at the Fondazione Prada in Milan in 2018.

results.title: Former Honduras Police Chief Charged With Drug Offenses
results.abstract: The police chief was charged in federal court in New York with helping to ship tons of cocaine into the United States at the behest of the Honduran president and his brother.

results.title: Who Should Wear Masks on Planes? More Airlines Say Everyone.
results.abstract: Major carriers are requiring masks on their flight crews. Delta and American Airlines decided that passengers must cover their faces, too.

multimedia.caption: Many airlines require crews to wear masks. On Thursday, American Airlines and Delta Air Lines said they would join Lufthansa, JetBlue and Frontier by adding a passenger mandate, too.
Many airlines require crews to wear masks. On Thursday, American Airlines and Delta Air Lines said they would join Lufthansa, JetBlue and Frontier by adding a passenger mandate, too.

results.title: One Dead and 5 Missing After Canadian Military Helicopter Crashes off Greece
results.abstract: The Cyclone helicopter was participating in a NATO training exercise. A Nova Scotia native died, and two others from the province were missing.

results.title: Idris Bey, an N.Y.C. Emergency Worker, Dies at 60
results.abstract: Mr. Bey, who died of the coronavirus, was a popular instructor at the Fire Department’s Emergency Medical academy.

multimedia.caption: Idris Bey served as an E.M.T. in New York City for 27 years. He was also a Marine, and on 9/11 rushed to the World Trade Center.
Idris Bey served as an E.M.T. in New York City for 27 years. He was also a Marine, and on 9/11 rushed to the World Trade Center.

results.title: En Perú, el virus provoca que miles de personas regresen al campo
results.abstract: El miedo al coronavirus y la pérdida de empleos en las ciudades están empujando a muchos peruanos a volver a las zonas rurales, lo que ha generado preocupación sobre una crisis de salud pública en el campo.
results.byline: BY ROSA CHÁVEZ YACILA AND JULIE TURKEWITZ

results.title: Willie Levi, 73, Dies; He Escaped a Life of Servitude
results.abstract: He was one of a group of men with disabilities who worked for substandard wages at a turkey plant but found justice. He succumbed to the new coronavirus.

multimedia.caption: Willie Levi in 2013. Intellectually disabled, he spent years working at a turkey-processing plant for $65 a month but found justice in a successful lawsuit.
Willie Levi in 2013. Intellectually disabled, he spent years working at a turkey-processing plant for $65 a month but found justice in a successful lawsuit.

results.title: Sister Patricia McGowan, Dedicated Teacher, Dies at 80
results.abstract: She joined the Sisters of Charity in New York in 1956 and taught at her alma mater, Mount Saint Vincent College, until 2019. She died from complications of the coronavirus.

multimedia.caption: Sister Patricia McGowan started as an elementary school teacher before spending most of her career as a professor at the College of Mount Saint Vincent in the Bronx, her alma mater.
Sister Patricia McGowan started as an elementary school teacher before spending most of her career as a professor at the College of Mount Saint Vincent in the Bronx, her alma mater.

results.title: As Workers Fall Ill, U.S. Presses Mexico to Keep American-Owned Plants Open
results.abstract: Multinational corporations with factories in Mexico have remained open, even after coronavirus outbreaks hit their facilities.

results.title: Andy Dalton Joins Crowded N.F.L. Free Agent Pool
results.abstract: After nine years starting at quarterback for the Cincinnati Bengals, Dalton joins two former No. 1 draft picks — Cam Newton and Jadeveon Clowney — among veteran players searching for jobs.

multimedia.caption: Andy Dalton was released by the Cincinnati Bengals on Thursday, joining Cam Newton, right, on a list of accomplished free agents as N.F.L. teams head into organized team activities.

results.title: Local journalism helps tell the full story
results.abstract: Local journalism is in crisis and at risk of disappearing. These vital resources are critical to the safety, security and knowledge of our communities, never more so than in these difficult times. On World Press Freedom Day and every day, we encourage you to find a local news organization you trust and support it.

results.title: Biden Will Address Tara Reade’s Allegation on MSNBC on Friday
results.abstract: After weeks of silence that prompted Democratic frustration, Joe Biden will discuss a former Senate aide’s allegation of sexual assault on “Morning Joe.”
